creditline: The John R. Van Derlip Fund
department: Chinese, South and Southeast Asian Art
description: Theatrical robe for a warrior, the heavy gold thread panels, body section, and epaulets representing the chain armor of a warrior.  Yoke of rust-red satin embroidered with five-clawed dragons in couched gold thread.  Tiger claw borders of colored brocades, wavy jewel, stone and metal bosses on velvet border bands throughout.  Sleeves of green satin banded with wavy strips of gold and colored brocades.  Skirt composed of five shaped panels.  Linig of pink satin.  Seal inscription in front.
markings: Seal in front. Not listed on card.
title: Theatrical Jacket and Skirt for a Warrior
